Class ValidationService

java.lang.Object
service.ValidationService
public class ValidationService extends Object
A utility service class for validating common input data such as NRICs, passwords, and dates. This class provides static methods to perform various validation checks. It is not intended to be instantiated, as it contains only static utility methods.

  • Method Details

    • isValidNric

      public static boolean isValidNric(String nric)
      Validates whether the given NRIC is in the correct format. The NRIC must start with a letter (S, T, F, or G), followed by 7 digits, and end with an uppercase letter.
      Parameters:
      nric - The NRIC to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the NRIC is valid according to the format, false otherwise.

    • isNullOrEmpty

      public static boolean isNullOrEmpty(String s)
      Checks if a given string is either null or empty (after trimming any whitespace).
      Parameters:
      s - The string to check.
      Returns:
      true if the string is null or empty, false otherwise.

    • validateNricAndPassword

      public static boolean validateNricAndPassword(String nric, String password)
      Validates the given NRIC and password. The NRIC is checked for validity using the isValidNric(java.lang.String) method, and the password is checked to ensure it is not null or empty.
      Parameters:
      nric - The NRIC to validate.
      password - The password to validate.
      Returns:
      true if both the NRIC is valid and the password is not null or empty, false otherwise.

    • isValidDate

      public static boolean isValidDate(String date)
      Validates if the given date is in the correct format (yyyy-MM-dd). The date is checked to ensure it consists of 4 digits for the year, 2 digits for the month, and 2 digits for the day.
      Parameters:
      date - The date string to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the date is in the correct format, false otherwise.
